name: df-cvm
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6, setvar s7
body: |- wceq(ccvm, cmpo(s0, s1, ctop, ctop, crab(s2, co(cv(s0), ccn, cv(s1)), wral(s3, cuni(cv(s1)), wrex(s4, cv(s1), wa(wcel(cv(s3), cv(s4)), wrex(s5, cdif(cpw(cv(s0)), csn(emptycls)), wa(wceq(cuni(cv(s5)), cima(ccnv(cv(s2)), cv(s4))), wral(s6, cv(s5), wa(wral(s7, cdif(cv(s5), csn(cv(s6))), wceq(cin(cv(s6), cv(s7)), emptycls)), wcel(cres(cv(s2), cv(s6)), co(co(cv(s0), crest, cv(s6)), chmeo, co(cv(s1), crest, cv(s4))))))))))))))
comment: Define the class of covering maps on two topological spaces. A function ` f : c --> j ` is a covering map if it is continuous and for every point ` x ` in the target space there is a neighborhood ` k ` of ` x ` and a decomposition ` s ` of the preimage of ` k ` as a disjoint union such that ` f ` is a homeomorphism of each set ` u e. s ` onto ` k ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Feb-2015.)
